properties.name: additionalMapOptions
properties.desc:
Additional map options for google.maps.Map constructor.
Use to specify additional options we do not expose as
properties.
Ex: `<google-map additional-map-options='{"mapTypeId":"satellite"}'>`

properties.name: apiKey
properties.desc: A Maps API key. To obtain an API key, see developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/tutorial#api_key.

properties.name: clear
properties.desc: Clears all markers from the map.

properties.name: clickEvents
properties.desc: When true, map *click events are automatically registered.

properties.name: clientId
properties.desc:
A Maps API for Business Client ID. To obtain a Maps API for Business Client ID, see developers.google.com/maps/documentation/business/.
If set, a Client ID will take precedence over an API Key.

properties.name: disableDefaultUi
properties.desc: If set, removes the map's default UI controls.

properties.name: disableZoom
properties.desc: If true, prevent the user from zooming the map interactively.

properties.name: dragEvents
properties.desc: When true, map drag* events are automatically registered.

properties.name: fitToMarkers
properties.desc: If set, the zoom level is set such that all markers (google-map-marker children) are brought into view.

properties.name: language
properties.desc:
The localized language to load the Maps API with. For more information
see https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/basics#Language

Note: the Maps API defaults to the preffered language setting of the browser.
Use this parameter to override that behavior.

properties.name: latitude
properties.desc: A latitude to center the map on.

properties.name: libraries
properties.desc:
A comma separated list (e.g. "places,geometry") of libraries to load
with this map. Defaults to "places". For more information see
https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/libraries.

properties.name: longitude
properties.desc: A longitude to center the map on.

properties.name: map
properties.desc: A Maps API object.

properties.name: mapType
properties.desc: Map type to display. One of 'roadmap', 'satellite', 'hybrid', 'terrain'.

properties.name: maxZoom
properties.desc: A maximum zoom level which will be displayed on the map.

properties.name: minZoom
properties.desc: A minimum zoom level which will be displayed on the map.

properties.name: mouseEvents
properties.desc: When true, map mouse* events are automatically registered.

properties.name: noAutoTilt
properties.desc: When set, prevents the map from tilting (when the zoom level and viewport supports it).

properties.name: resize
properties.desc:
Explicitly resizes the map, updating its center. This is useful if the
map does not show after you have unhidden it.

properties.name: signedIn
properties.desc:
If true, sign-in is enabled.
See https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/signedin#enable_sign_in

properties.name: styles
properties.desc:
If set, custom styles can be applied to the map.
For style documentation see developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference#MapTypeStyle

properties.name: version
properties.desc: Version of the Google Maps API to use.

properties.name: zoom
properties.desc: A zoom level to set the map to.

properties.name: _observeMarkers
properties.desc: watch for future updates

elements.desc: The `google-map-marker` element represents a map marker. It is used as a child of `google-map`. Example: Example - marker with info window (children create the window content): Example - a draggable marker: Example - hide a marker:

elements.desc:
Provides the Google Maps API Directions Service to provide directions
between a `startAddress` and `endAddress`.

See https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/directions for more
information on the API.

#### Example:

    <template is="dom-bind">
      <google-map-directions map="{{map}}"
          start-address="San Francisco"
          end-address="Mountain View"
          travel-mode="TRANSIT"></google-map-directions>
      <google-map map="{{map}}" latitude="37.779"
                  longitude="-122.3892"></google-map>
    </template>

events.desc: Fired whenever the directions service returns a result.

jsdoc.description: Fired whenever the directions service returns a result.

events.name: google-map-response

properties.name: apiKey
properties.desc: A Maps API key. To obtain an API key, see developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/tutorial#api_key.

properties.name: endAddress
properties.desc: End address or latlng for directions to end.

properties.name: language
properties.desc:
The localized language to load the Maps API with. For more information
see https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/basics#Language

Note: the Maps API defaults to the preffered language setting of the browser.
Use this parameter to override that behavior.

properties.name: libraries
properties.desc:
A comma separated list (e.g. "places,geometry") of libraries to load
with this map. Defaults to "places". For more information see
https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/libraries.

Note, this needs to be set to the same value as the one used on <google-map>.
If you're overriding that element's `libraries` property, this one also
needs to be set to the Maps API loads the library code.

properties.name: map
properties.desc: The Google map object.

properties.name: response
properties.desc: The response from the directions service.

properties.name: startAddress
properties.desc: Start address or latlng to get directions from.

properties.name: travelMode
properties.desc: Travel mode to use.  One of 'DRIVING', 'WALKING', 'BICYCLING', 'TRANSIT'.

properties.name: mouseEvents
properties.desc: When true, marker mouse* events are automatically registered.

properties.name: zIndex
properties.desc: Z-index for the marker icon.

google-map-search.desc: Provides Google Maps Places API functionality. See https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/places for more information on the API. #### Example:

events.desc: Fired when the search element returns a result.

jsdoc.description: Fired when the search element returns a result.

tags.name: detail.show
tags.description: Whether to show the result on the map.

events.name: google-map-search-result

params.desc: Whether to show the result on the map.
params.name: detail.show

properties.name: map
properties.desc: The Google map object.

properties.name: query
properties.desc: The search query.

properties.name: result
properties.desc: The search result.

properties.name: search
properties.desc: Performance a search using for `query` for the search term.

google-map-directions.desc:
Provides the Google Maps API Directions Service to provide directions
between a `startAddress` and `endAddress`.

See https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/directions for more
information on the API.

#### Example:

    <template is="dom-bind">
      <google-map-directions map="{{map}}"
          start-address="San Francisco"
          end-address="Mountain View"
          travel-mode="TRANSIT"></google-map-directions>
      <google-map map="{{map}}" latitude="37.779"
                  longitude="-122.3892"></google-map>
    </template>

events.desc: Fired whenever the directions service returns a result.

jsdoc.description: Fired whenever the directions service returns a result.

events.name: google-map-response

properties.name: apiKey
properties.desc: A Maps API key. To obtain an API key, see developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/tutorial#api_key.

properties.name: endAddress
properties.desc: End address or latlng for directions to end.

properties.name: language
properties.desc:
The localized language to load the Maps API with. For more information
see https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/basics#Language

Note: the Maps API defaults to the preffered language setting of the browser.
Use this parameter to override that behavior.

properties.name: libraries
properties.desc:
A comma separated list (e.g. "places,geometry") of libraries to load
with this map. Defaults to "places". For more information see
https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/libraries.

Note, this needs to be set to the same value as the one used on <google-map>.
If you're overriding that element's `libraries` property, this one also
needs to be set to the Maps API loads the library code.

properties.name: map
properties.desc: The Google map object.

properties.name: response
properties.desc: The response from the directions service.

properties.name: startAddress
properties.desc: Start address or latlng to get directions from.

properties.name: travelMode
properties.desc: Travel mode to use.  One of 'DRIVING', 'WALKING', 'BICYCLING', 'TRANSIT'.
